fields.description:
JDBC drivers can be shipped for most/all of our supported databases.
Brian says we are now even allowed to ship with a MySQL driver.
fields.summary: We should include JDBC drivers in the standalone edition in order to make installation and configuration easier

fields.description: Jira could really use a public-facing customer support page which allows users to submit a ticket without going directly into JIRA itself.
fields.summary: Help Desk - Customer Screen

fields.description:
As stated before in JRA-9048, in Austria, Germany, UK and also the Netherlands, the first calendar week doesn't depend on our first day of week (monday), it's defined the first week with 4 days in the new year. 

quote from wikipedia:

...The international standard ISO 8601 also defines Monday as the first day of the week. In practice, this means that calendar formats disagree, and that "next week" said on Sunday means "the week beginning tomorrow".

In that international standard, the "first week of the year" is that week which includes the first Thursday of the year.

Is if possible to configure Jira so that the first week of in year 2010 wil start on Monday January fourth 2010. Now it shows 3-1-2010 as the start of week 2.
fields.summary: calendar issue: In the Netherlands the first week of 2010 should start on Monday January fourth.

fields.description: JIRA had a bug where user can create multiple status name with same name. Upgrade will show wrong results as we don't support that. Please refer to JRA-18933 and document it in upgrade guide.
fields.summary: Need to document the implication of JRA-18933 in upgrade guide.

fields.description:
Steps to replicate the problem.

In Windows Vista, set the timezone to (GMT +07:00) Bangkok, Hanoi, Jakarta

Set the language to Thai

Start Jira, and try to subscribe to a filter. Set the subscription time to 9:30 PM

You will get an error message saying "Filter with cron expression '0 30 21 ? * *' will never run."
fields.summary: Cannot subscribe to filter in Bangkok timezone, Windows Vista

fields.description: when viewing https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-2146 I frequently get attached report. The browser spins and spins.
fields.summary: SAC fires javascript error when viewing issues

fields.description:
Page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+the+Watched+Issues+Gadget

has a screenshot of the old portlet from the pre JIRA 4.0 release:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/185729589/portlets-watchedissues_dashboard.png?version=2&modificationDate=1240007647062

the unwatch operation doesn't exist any longer in the Watched Issues Gadget.

Perhaps we could also add some information re unwatching issues in the 4.0 release.
fields.summary: Adding the Watched Issues Gadget page needs to be updated

fields.description:
Here's what I did:

FAVOURITE FILTERS:
1. add the Favourite Filters gadget to the dashboard
2. the Favourite Filters gadget gives the message "You have no favourite filters at the moment"
3. created 3 'favourite' filters
4. the Favourite Filters gadget still gives the message "You have no favourite filters at the moment"
5. logged out and back in
6. the Favourite Filters gadget still gives the message "You have no favourite filters at the moment"
7. after a couple of minutes, the Favourite Filters gadget correctly displays my favourite filters

ISSUE IN PROGRESS:
1. add the Issue In Progress gadget to the dashboard
2. the gadget shows no issues (even though I do have some in progress)
7. after a couple of minutes, the Issue In Progress gadget correctly displays my issues-in-progress
fields.summary: 'Favourite Filters' and 'In Progress' gadgets intially display nothing (in IE 8)

fields.description:
CURRENTLY READS:
"Display the number issues the filter returns"

SHOULD READ:
"Display the number of issues the filter returns"
fields.summary: typo on the 'Favourite Filters' configuration page

fields.description: We would like the ability to edit simple text file attachements in JIRA.  We use these text files to automate our build system and occassionally need to edit simple text files that are attached to JIRA tickets.
fields.summary: Would like the ability to edit text attachments in JIRA

fields.description: If a user accidentally uses a lower case project key in CVS, it is not mapped to the upper case project key. What we want is for the CVS parsing to be case INsensitive.
fields.summary: CVS Case sensitivity

fields.description:
When I request saved filters via SOAP, I no longer get an XML describing the filter. All I get is the name. JIRA version 3.13 was not affected by this issue.

This means that current JIRA Client users won't see their saved filters in JIRA Client.

Example:

Currently returned from getFavouriteFilters:
{code:xml}
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
   <soapenv:Body>
      <ns1:getFavouriteFiltersResponse soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xmlns:ns1="http://soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com">
         <getFavouriteFiltersReturn soapenc:arrayType="ns2:RemoteFilter[1]" xsi:type="soapenc:Array" xmlns:ns2="http://beans.soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com" xmlns:soapenc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/">
            <getFavouriteFiltersReturn href="#id0"/>
         </getFavouriteFiltersReturn>
      </ns1:getFavouriteFiltersResponse>
      <multiRef id="id0" soapenc:root="0" soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xsi:type="ns3:RemoteFilter" xmlns:soapenc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xmlns:ns3="http://beans.soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com">
         <author xsi:type="xsd:string">sereda</author>
         <description xsi:type="xsd:string" xsi:nil="true"/>
         <id xsi:type="xsd:string">18015</id>
         <name xsi:type="xsd:string">open bugs</name>
         <project xsi:type="xsd:string" xsi:nil="true"/>
         <xml xsi:type="xsd:string" xsi:nil="true"/>
      </multiRef>
   </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>
{code}

Returned by JIRA 3.13:
{code:xml}
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
   <soapenv:Body>
      <ns1:getFavouriteFiltersResponse soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xmlns:ns1="http://soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com">
         <getFavouriteFiltersReturn soapenc:arrayType="ns2:RemoteFilter[1]" xsi:type="soapenc:Array" xmlns:ns2="http://beans.soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com" xmlns:soapenc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/">
            <getFavouriteFiltersReturn href="#id0"/>
         </getFavouriteFiltersReturn>
      </ns1:getFavouriteFiltersResponse>
      <multiRef id="id0" soapenc:root="0" soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xsi:type="ns3:RemoteFilter" xmlns:soapenc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xmlns:ns3="http://beans.soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com">
         <author xsi:type="xsd:string">sereda</author>
         <description xsi:type="xsd:string" xsi:nil="true"/>
         <id xsi:type="xsd:string">10000</id>
         <name xsi:type="xsd:string">Platform 2.0 Unresolved</name>
         <project xsi:type="xsd:string">10003</project>
         <xml xsi:type="xsd:string"><![CDATA[<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
<searchrequest name='Platform 2.0 Unresolved'>
  <parameter class='com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.parameters.lucene.ProjectParameter'>
    <projid andQuery='false'>
      <value>10003</value>
    </projid>
  </parameter>
  <parameter class='com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.parameters.lucene.IssueConstantsParameter'>
    <resolution andQuery='false'>
      <value>-1</value>
    </resolution>
  </parameter>
  <sort class='com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchSort'>
    <searchSort field='issuekey' order='DESC'/>
  </sort>
</searchrequest>]]></xml>
      </multiRef>
   </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>
{code}
fields.summary: getSavedFilters / getFavouriteFilters do not return filter's XML

fields.description:
First run:

Create a new project with a specific issue type scheme eg. issue types A and B. These issues may also have different workflows. Now create some new issues and switch their statuses. Then create another NEW issue type scheme with issues B and C. C has again another workflow.

Go to admin project and switch from old to NEW issue type scheme. You will be asked to migrate (map) issue types of kind A to either B or C.

Second run:

Repeat all steps from the beginning. Before switching issue type scheme remove yourself all rights to access the project. When switching issue type scheme you won't be asked to migrate (map) the issues. At least type A will not be available when creating new issues.

Either this could be a good feature for keeping old issues for history untouched, this behavior is inconsistency to the switch of workflow schemes. This works, regardless of the access rights of a project.
fields.summary: Inconsistent migration of issues type scheme due to access rights

fields.description:
We should not be including jquery ui in the javascript supplied to ever gadget.  This adds roughly 200k per gadget and is never used.

We could most probably remove a few other things from the ajs bundle as well.
fields.summary: Remove jquery ui from gadget javascript.

fields.description:
Our current guide for watching or voting on issues doesn't seem to have actual pictures of the Watch It or Vote For It in the user's guide.

OR

   http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Watching+and+Voting+on+an+Issue
fields.summary: How to "watch or vote" on an issue in JIRA

fields.description:
{quote}Bugzilla Severity maps to JIRA Priority and Bugzilla Priority is ignored...

Doc Issues:
1. Bugzilla Severity maps to Jira Priority, and Bugzilla Priority is ignored - that's clear from the results of the import. But in the table in 1.10.1, under Bugs, 5th bullet, It starts by saying "Bug_Severity in Bugzilla is mapped to Priorities in JIRA. ", but then says "Note: if you have customized the Bugzilla list of priorities...". That note should say "severities".
2. Also towards the end, particularly section 1.10.1.5, it references only the bugzilla Priority field and not the Severity field in the text and by showing the sql for the priority column. This is a bit confusing (esp. given all the hullabulloo about Priorities vs. Severities over the years). It should only reference the Severity field for Bugzilla.
{quote}

The current docs incorrectly mention Bugzilla priority rather than severity: 
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/bugzilla_import.html

This has been corrected in the CAC docs but not the WAC docs (note, pdf is dynamically generated from WAC docs)
fields.summary: "Importing Data from Bugzilla" doc errors - 'priority' references should be 'severity'

fields.description: When testing out an import from FogBugz into JIRA, I would have expected users that are subscribed to a particular issue in FogBugz to be converted to Watchers of the converted issue in JIRA.  The importer appears to ignore this information as far as I can tell.
fields.summary: FogBugz Importer does not convert Subscribers to Watchers

Issue Nav Improvements

fields.description:
Given the CSV:
{noformat}
type,summary,status,realstatus
Bug,Womble,ignorethis,Closed
{noformat}

mapped such that realstatus is mapped to Status:

!csvmapping.png!


Resulting in this properties file:

{noformat}
# written by PropertiesConfiguration
# Fri Sep 25 00:39:35 EDT 2009
delimiter = \,
existingprojectkey = AE
importsingleproject = false
importexistingproject = true
mapfromcsv = false
field.summary = summary
field.realstatus = status
field.type = type
value.type.Bug = 1
value.realstatus.Closed = 10003
user.email.suffix = @atlassian.com
{noformat}

Importing breaks with:

{noformat}
[00:39:39] FAILED: Error importing issue Issue {summary=Womble, type=1}
[00:39:39] com.atlassian.jira.external.ExternalException: Unable to create issue: Womble
	at com.atlassian.jira.external.ExternalUtils.createIssue(ExternalUtils.java:320)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importIssues(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:508)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.doImport(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:125)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.importer.impl.ImporterThread.run(ImporterThread.java:21)
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.external.ExternalException: Cannot find status with id 'ignorethis'.
	at com.atlassian.jira.external.ExternalUtils.checkStatus(ExternalUtils.java:343)
	at com.atlassian.jira.external.ExternalUtils.createIssue(ExternalUtils.java:306)
	... 3 more
{noformat}

For some reason the status mapping isn't being persisted, and the importer assumes the 'status' column maps.
fields.summary: CSV importer fails if column called 'status' is not mapped to Status

fields.description:
Hello,

the Popular Issues Project Tab only counts the votes directly cast in favour of the issue itself. Votes for Linked issues are not taken into account while a certain degree of dispersion for "duplicates", "relates to", "incorporated by" issues always occurs - besides I don't think it's possible to tweak or move votes across issues without direct database manipulation so it is difficult to "refactor" issues without loosing this information.

It would be beneficial if it was possible to configure this statistic to include (perhaps with a weight) the vote count from linked issues so that, for example the votes for issue A would count in the chart position of incorporating issue B.


Best Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: Include linked issues votes in issue popularity rating

fields.description:
Gadget is resizing for the configuration menu but is resized again to original size of view menu before it is fully loaded.
This is due to igoogle using a dropdown button for configurations which triggers the restoreHeight fix for JRA-19028.
Problem does not occur in jira itself.
fields.summary: Gadgets not resizing correctly in igoogle

fields.description:
Developing plugins is a major PITA unless we make our modules re-loadable.

There's 2 parts to this. Firstly I'll make a change in atlassian-plugins to disable the @RequiresRestart annotation if dev.mode is true.  Secondly I'll try to make as many module descriptors as possible reloadable in JIRA.
fields.summary: Make JIRA plugin modules reloadable

fields.description:
If you deploy JIRA in Jboss 4.2.1 and older, 1.5+ JVM and navigate to the view projects page, you get the following stacktrace:
{noformat}
2009-09-24 08:25:34,613 http-127.0.0.1-8080-16 ERROR test 30333x38x1 1pevvl4 /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa [web].[localhost].[/jira].[action]] Servlet.service() for servlet action threw exception
org.apache.jasper.JasperException: Unable to compile class for JSP: 

An error occurred at line: 39 in the jsp file: /decorators/admin.jsp
Type mismatch: cannot convert from Object to ReindexMessageManager
36:                 HttpSession httpSession = request.getSession(false); //dont create the session if there isnt one
37:                 User remoteUser = httpSession != null ? (User) httpSession.getAttribute(DefaultAuthenticator.LOGGED_IN_KEY) : null;
38: 
39:                 ReindexMessageManager reindexMessageManager = ComponentManager.getComponentInstanceOfType(ReindexMessageManager.class);
40:                 final String message = reindexMessageManager.getMessage(remoteUser);
41:                 if (!StringUtils.isBlank(message))
42:                 {


Stacktrace:
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.DefaultErrorHandler.javacError(DefaultErrorHandler.java:92)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.ErrorDispatcher.javacError(ErrorDispatcher.java:330)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.JDTCompiler.generateClass(JDTCompiler.java:415)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Compiler.compile(Compiler.java:308)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Compiler.compile(Compiler.java:286)
	at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Compiler.compile(Compiler.java:273)
	at org.apache.jasper.JspCompilationContext.compile(JspCompilationContext.java:566)
	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServletWrapper.service(JspServletWrapper.java:311)
	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.serviceJspFile(JspServlet.java:320)
	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.service(JspServlet.java:266)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:803)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:290)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
{noformat}

This problem is being caused by the fact that JIRA 4.0 is not compatible with the JAVA 1.4 compiler and a bug in Jboss 4.2.0 reported in [JBAS-4605|https://jira.jboss.org/jira/browse/JBAS-4605].
fields.summary: JSP compliation error in Jboss 4.2.1

fields.description:
When trying to set a custom field value to -1 the value is not set in the field. After editing the issue, the custom field does not appear in the screen. Other negative values (e.g. -12, -2, ...) do work, so I could only replicate with -1.

Tested with both text field and numeric fields.
fields.summary: Cannot set '-1' as a custom field value

fields.description:
When exporting to excel the content of the issue navigator, if a custom field has a negative value (e.g. -12) then the field will be prepended with a single quote (e.g. '-12)

This bug cannot be reproduce with Jira 4.0 RC1
fields.summary: Excel view appends a quote (') before negative values

fields.description:
Formatting in JIRA documentation needs some tidying up:

* Numbered instructions in admin guide need purple panels, as per our other product doc admin guides.
* Numbered instructions in user guide need blue panels, as per our other product doc user guides.
fields.summary: Fix formatting in JIRA documentation

fields.description:
When using the User Picker in the Issue Navigator e.g. for the Reporter field, the suggestions can be incorrect.
E.g. type in "wa" wait for one second and type "ter" the suggestion can come up for "wa" and not for "water".
The response for the suggestions of "wa" can override the response for the suggestions of "water".

The user picker should discard a response for an older request.
This is also causing us problems when running our selenium tests.
fields.summary: User Picker auto-complete suggestions can be incorrect

fields.description: Currently it is on the left-hand side, which means that users who are trained to use the Tools menu don't find it.
fields.summary: Add 'save filter' link to the tools menu in issue navigator
Add save filter menu item to the Tools menu in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Goto project tab and select any project having component and versions.
3. Click on version/component tab and select any version or component.
4. View the tool tip of project/project avatar link.The tooltip says "Back to component/version(dep on selection) tab of project XYZ"
5. Click on it

Result:
1. It take user to the summary tab of the project.
2. User has no straight way to go back to component/version tab.
3. Clicking on project menu in header takes you back to component/version tab.

Expected:
1. Clicking on project name/avatar should take back user to the last selected tab.
fields.summary: Links to breadcumb and project avatar in browse project is not working as expected when user is inside version/component

fields.description:
See JRA-19210, for sample data and instructions on how to replicate.

Looks like in IE, when displaying a lot of issues in the Issue Navigator, generating the actions menu takes a long enough time in IE 7 (and maybe with other IE versions), such that IE prompts the user to stop executing the JavaScript script.

Stopping the execution, stops other JavaScript onLoad code to not run and therefore leads to other functionality not working, such as the user profile drop down not working (JRA-19210).
fields.summary: Actions menu in Issue Navigator with lots of results takes a very long time in IE

fields.description:
The project list on the Personal Roadmap screen uses too much vertical screen real estate.  This has a negative impact on the usability and value of this feature.

Our setup is as follows:
* All developers are added to the jira-developers group.
* We have almost 100 projects in our JIRA instance and most have the "jira-developers" group included in the Developers project role.  This reduces the project management burden of maintaining the list of developers for a project.

When a developer navigates to the Personal Roadmap, they will see a list of all of the JIRA projects, even if they only have assigned issues in a handful of these projects.

Suggested improvements:
* Replace the project list with a UI component that uses less real estate, such as a drop-down list.
* Only show projects on this page for which the user has one or more issues assigned to them.
fields.summary: The project list on the Personal Roadmap screen uses too much vertical screen real estate, reducing usability

fields.description:
Standalone version has these settings already.
Need to document increased requirements for WAR.
This may bump up hardware requirements?
fields.summary: Need to document the fact that JIRA v4.0 may need more PermGen than v3.x

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Try to install JIRA 4.0 using installer.
2. By default it show user path as "c:\program files\........
3. Browse and select the path as c:\

Result:

Expected:

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Try to install JIRA on windows using installer.
2. There is a link on 2nd screen ""How to Upgarde JIRA" . Click on it.

Result:
1. It take user to "http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v4.0-SNAPSHOT/upgrading.html"

Expected:
1. Link should be correct and point to right docs.
fields.summary: "How to Upgrade JIRA" link in JIRA installer is not pointing to right link

fields.description:
In 3.13 it was possible to specify the number of stats to display on the 2d Stats portlet. Not specifying any value for this field meant that all stats should be displayed.

{code}
            final Integer numberToShow =
                    (numberToShowString == null || numberToShowString.length() == 0)
                            ? new Integer(Integer.MAX_VALUE)    // if not specified set max intereger = unlimited
                            : new Integer(numberToShowString);  // otherwise set to specified value

{code}
However, in the 4.0 upgrade we take a null value to be an unexpected state and set a default value of 5. Thus in 4.0 we show only 5 stats while in 3.13 we show all the stats.

There may be other portlets/gadgets this affects.
fields.summary: The 2d Stats Portlet Upgrade Task can change the behaviour of the gadget/portlet between 4.0 in 3.13.
Entering a negative value in the timespent breaks the worklogs and invalidates the issue

fields.description:
The issue navigator shows a 500 page when indexing is disabled. I know we added some code to display a nice error message, but this appears to no longer work. I believe Jed and Chris made the IndexManager through a RuntimeException so that the gadgets could detect when indexing is disabled. This is not very useful for the navigator. I am also sure there are other places in JIRA where we do searches where similar issues will result. 

Steps:

# Remove JIRA index directory.
# Restart JIRA
# Try and do a search.
fields.summary: The Advanced Navigator shows the 500 page when trying to do a search with indexing disabled.

fields.description:
Select any issue. Click on the "Comment on this issue" link
Enter some text into the Comment box. Instead of "Add", click "Cancel".
Now, you are viewing an issue.
Try to do anything else, even clicking on the link to view the same issue. 
You get the nasty message 

Are you sure you want to navigate away from this page?
You have entered new data on this page. If you navigate away from this page without first saving
your data, the changes will be lost.
Press OK to continue, or Cancel to stay on the current page.
fields.summary: Nasty warning message when doing any activity while viewing an issue

fields.description:
The issue filter gadget is not properly rendering the control footer.

"Displaying issues 1 to 10 of 12 matching issues"

It's the gadget in the upper left corner of the screenshot attached to this issue.
fields.summary: filter results gadget is not rendering with the correct height

fields.description:
After moving an issue from one project into another, the attachment can longer be accessed, because the move operation failed. The attachment file name contains spaces and this seems to be (one part of) the problem.

{noformat}
2009-09-22 14:41:02,945 http-jira.epages.de%2F217.17.196.15-443-Processor16 WARN [web.action.issue.MoveIssueConfirm] Could not move the attachment 'a
us gegebenem Anlass  neues Boilerplate.msg' because it does not exist at the expected location '/opt/jira/WORK/ATTACHMENTS/MKT/MKT-846/16381_aus gege
benem Anlass  neues Boilerplate.msg'.
{noformat}

{noformat}
[root@jira ~]# echo $LANG
en_US.UTF-8
{noformat}

{noformat}
[root@jira ~]# ls -hall /opt/jira/WORK/ATTACHMENTS/PR/PR-28
total 40K
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root 4.0K Sep 22 14:41 .
drwxr-xr-x 8 root root 4.0K Sep 22 15:35 ..
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root  29K Jul 10 11:28 16381_aus gegebenem Anlass  neues Boilerplate.msg
[root@jira ~]# ls -hall /opt/jira/WORK/ATTACHMENTS/PR/PR-29
total 8.0K
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root 4.0K Sep 22 14:41 .
drwxr-xr-x 8 root root 4.0K Sep 22 15:35 ..
{noformat}

This is very strange the attachment can be found under _PR-28_ while the new issue is _PR-29_. If I try to open _PR-28_ I will be forwarded to _PR-29_. So the problem seems to be these two issue keys. The change history of that issue reflects that weird behaviour.
fields.summary: Moving issues: WARN [web.action.issue.MoveIssueConfirm] Could not move the attachment <name> because it does not exist at the expected location

fields.description:
I have my jira server set up on a host at 10.0.2.16, port 9090
on the machine I am hitting the server from, I have a hosts entry
10.0.2.16 dev

when I hit the url:
http://dev:9090

I get the following stack trace in the log:
2009-09-22 09:25:45,760 http-9090-Processor10 ERROR kem 33945x216x1 1udt2o0 http://dev:9090/secure/Dashboard.jspa [renderer.internal.http.HttpClientFetcher] Unable to retrieve response
java.net.UnknownHostException: dev
        at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connect(PlainSocketImpl.java:177)
        at java.net.SocksSocketImpl.connect(SocksSocketImpl.java:367)
        at java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:524)
        at org.apache.http.conn.scheme.PlainSocketFactory.connectSocket(PlainSocketFactory.java:123)
        at org.apache.http.impl.conn.DefaultClientConnectionOperator.openConnection(DefaultClientConnectionOperator.java:123)
        at org.apache.http.impl.conn.AbstractPoolEntry.open(AbstractPoolEntry.java:147)
        at org.apache.http.impl.conn.AbstractPooledConnAdapter.open(AbstractPooledConnAdapter.java:101)
        at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRequestDirector.execute(DefaultRequestDirector.java:381)
        at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.execute(AbstractHttpClient.java:641)
        at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.execute(AbstractHttpClient.java:576)
        at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.execute(AbstractHttpClient.java:554)
        at com.atlassian.gadgets.renderer.internal.http.HttpClientFetcher.fetch(HttpClientFetcher.java:91)
        at org.apache.shindig.gadgets.DefaultGadgetSpecFactory.fetchObjectAndCache(DefaultGadgetSpecFactory.java:124)
        at org.apache.shindig.gadgets.DefaultGadgetSpecFactory.getGadgetSpec(DefaultGadgetSpecFactory.java:89)
        at org.apache.shindig.gadgets.DefaultGadgetSpecFactory.getGadgetSpec(DefaultGadgetSpecFactory.java:72)

and the dashboards all have the following error:
Error loading gadget: org.apache.shindig.gadgets.GadgetException: Unable to retrieve gadget xml. HTTP error 500

if I hit the url:
http://10.0.2.16:9090

everything works properly

attached are log files -- I shutdown the server, deleted the log files, started it up, hit http://dev:9090, then shut the server back down, copied all the log files into the tar
fields.summary: jira server doesn't handle a host file entry on the client properly

fields.description:
If I search for a summary using prefix-wildcard search and specify prefix larger than 14 characters, the result will be empty even if there are matching issues.

Example:

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?component=10480&summary=true&pid=10240&type=2&reset=true&show=View+%26gt%3B%26gt%3B&query=%2BgetFieldsForCr* 

shows JRA-11597, which has "getFieldsForCreation()" in the summary. we search for "getFieldsForCr*", 14-character prefix + wildcard

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?component=10480&summary=true&pid=10240&type=2&reset=true&show=View+%26gt%3B%26gt%3B&query=%2BgetFieldsForCre* 

same request, with one letter added to the prefix - the result set is empty
fields.summary: Wildcard search does not work if prefix is over 14 characters

fields.description:
An issue contains text with German umlauts or special characters like:
ö ä ü ß

The text is displayed correctly in the web interface but when sending a mail notification as text, these special characters are replaced by blanks.
fields.summary: E-Mail notification does not send German umlauts

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create new version in project that contains national characters in its name (e.g. Nákup or Ščítanie)
2. Assign new issue to this fix version
3. Open issue navigator (filter) and choose only project and the newly created fix version
4. You will see correct result with one issue
5. Now export the result, for example in XLS format with current fields. The exported file contains no issues.

It's obviously a problem with special characters in version name. If we use name without special characters the export works just fine.

Current workaround is not to use these characters.
fields.summary: Filter by "Fix version" column returns no issues in any export (e.g. XLS) when fix version contains national characters with accent (diacritics)

fields.description: Changing the Indexing language does not inform the user that they must do a re-index. We do this for most other things.
fields.summary: Changing the Indexing language does not inform the user that they must do a re-index.

fields.description:
Steps:

1. I have got this issue while testing with customer data at https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-39999
2. Login as toursadmin. The user has preferences set for viewing 1000 issues per page in issue naviagtor.
3. Run a query which return large number of issues. I executed "issuetype in ("Analyst Task","Bug sub-task",CTR,standardIssueTypes())"
4. Try to perform sorting on any column.

Result:
1. After sometime user gets a message saying that "A script runing....." and a "yes" and "no" option. If user click "Yes" to stop the script, and now try to access the user drop down in top right corner, nothing happens.
2. The link is pointed to the sort link of last sorted column.

Expected:
1. The user dropdown should be working without any issues
fields.summary: User dropdown link doesn't work when user click "Yes" to stop running the script in IE 7.0

fields.description:
We fixed it so that the table does not get covered by making it relatively positioned. BUT the description still seems to have a grey background instead of white.

Hmmmm....
fields.summary: On the configure user columns page the upper portion of the page still has a grey background to the right when the issue table pushes out, might want to fix this

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JAC.
2. For any already created issue, click on "Attach file" link.

Result:
1. The user is taken to "Attach files" page, the alignment of alignment label and textbox is not proper.
2. The issue is in 3.13.5 also.

Expected:
1. The label and textbox should be aligned.
fields.summary: The alignment of attachment label and text box is not proper for attach file link

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Search for some issues in issue navigator.
3. Click Tools->Configure Columns

Result:
1. The screen is not rendered properly. Screen shot attached.

Expected:
1. The configure column screen should be appearing fine and user should be able to add and delete columns
fields.summary: Configure columns for in issue navigator doesn't render properly in IE 7.0
No function in API to create,update or delete additional User property

fields.description:
I am evaluating v4. When I try to import our current database (3.13.2) I get an error: 

Error importing data: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericDelegator.makeValue] could not find entity for entityName: WorklogExt

I assume this is caused by the absence of the Kaamelot plugin. I have not changed my entitydefs config files. I would expect that the import would not be affected by this, but just ignores the none standard Jira tables/columns or what ever is missing here (I would loose the custom data) and I have a 'clean' Jira install.

Regards,

Ray

{panel:title=Possible Workaround| borderStyle=dashed| titleBGColor=#AAAAff| bgColor=#FFFFCE} 
*If you need to wipe out Minyaa data from your backup file, you can follow the workaround described [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-19202?focusedCommentId=432367&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-432367].*
{panel}
fields.summary: Problem with import when 3.xx uses Kaamelot plugin

fields.description:
There should be a way to set up screen schemes based by users/groups. That way it would be easy to let users (i.e. customers) report bugs by filling out only summary and (optionally) description, while project lead/technician can fill in the blanks, i.e. estimated time, assignee and any other fields the customer shouldn't be touching.

It would also allow for certain fields to be easily hidden for certain users (again: customers), such as assignee (to prevent them from contacting the assignee directly), time estimates etc.

Like when I reported this, I said that one developer should do it in one day. Those fields should probably be hidden for users like me. ;-)
fields.summary: Screen Schemes by user/group

fields.description:
Too much screen space wasted in comparison with JIRA 3.x
I like more condensed representation, in 4.0 it's too thin.
See screenshot.
fields.summary: Reduce line spacing in issue statistics gadget

fields.description:
A classloader leak has been found where a {{commons-logging}} {{Log}} instance is created per instance of the {{DefaultServletModuleManager}} class rather than statically. The class is loaded by the application class loader but the instance may be loaded from within an OSGi bundle.

This is only a problem when:

# The class has been used (and therefore loaded) and then
# A full data-import is performed

If this happens then a small amount of permgen is leaked to a now redundant classloader that is still referenced from commons-logging.

In practice this only really happens during functional testing, specifically the Fisheye Plugin functional tests. It is unlikely to cause customers any problem in practice and if it does, the workaround is to restart JIRA.

The fix is in {{atlassian-plugins-2.3.2}} and above. We need to upgrade the plugins version. Details can be [found here|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PLUG-449].
fields.summary: Classloader leak in atlassian-plugins-2.3.1

fields.summary: jira-fisheye plugin Perforce custom fields produce exceptions when perforce integration is not configured

fields.description: The translation keys are showing when I try to configure the 2d stats gadget. Check out the attached image.
fields.summary: The 2d Stats Portlet configuration does not appear to be fully translated.

fields.description:
The Wiki preview does not work correctly when your markup has an image. For example,

1. Create an issue.
2. Attach an image.
3. Create a comment with a link to the image and preview. You will get something like:

!bad_preview.png!
fields.summary: A wiki preview with an image does not render correctly under FF 3.5.3

fields.description:
If a very long non-wrappable string is added to a description in JIRA, the entire page is stretched to fit the string. This results in custom fields looking like they don't contain any data, due to the values being pushed off the right-hand side of the screen.

May I suggest simply adding a horizontal scrollbar to the description block, so as to keep the page width within the available width of the screen.
fields.summary: Add horizontal scrollbar to description view

fields.description:
The attached file is offending text.

It simply does not render
fields.summary: The SAC intro gadget is broken

fields.description: Need to fallback to hard-coded values in code if the application properties aren't set.
fields.summary: ResourceDateValidator throws nullpointer exception if jira-application.properties doesn't have jira.chart.previous.limit.xx definitions

fields.description: See attached screenshot
fields.summary: Issue gadget sometimes failes to align itself to the bounding window

fields.description:
Reproduction sequence:
1. Install JIRA 4 beta 5
2. Add custom fields of every possible type to the configuration (22 standard types)
3. Create a couple of issues
4. Open issue navigator showing this issues and select XML view

The result is the XML with an exception instead of content. I'm attaching the full page source.
This is critical problem for JIRA Client, and probably other remote clients! Without XML view, we cannot search in JIRA.
fields.summary: XML view is broken in JIRA 4: NPE and getCustomFieldXML (when there are Perfoce-related fields)

fields.description:
When viewing JIRA in Opera 9.51, the login page shows the following in large friendly letters:

Warning: either you have javascript disabled or your browser does not support javascript. To work properly, this page requires javascript to be enabled.

(The javascripts is enabled, of course)
fields.summary: JIRA 4 complains about "javascript disabled" in Opera browser

fields.description:
I want to build views of defects like:

Fixed by [user]
Fixed after [Date]
Reopened after [Date]
Closed by [user]

etc...

Right now, only Updated By and Update Date are available
fields.summary: add the ability to query defects based on workflow transition dates and actors

fields.description:
I would like to make Fixed Version a required field - however the appropriate time to set Fixed Version is after the defect has been fixed.

If I set the Fixed Version field to required, and remove it from the default screen, add it to the workflow and fix screens, new defects can't be created because Fixed Version is required but not available to be edited.
fields.summary: some required fields should only be required for specific screens

fields.description:
Adminitration | CVS Modules | Add CVS Module

The CVS Timeout parameter description says "The number of seconds a CVS operation (e.g. rlog) takes to timeout. Default - 600 seconds", with 600 set as the value. However, when module is added, the value seems to be treated as *milliseconds*. 

This is the error message I get when adding a CVS module with timeout set to 6000:

Errors
* Error occurred while retrieving cvs log: CVS Operation exceeded 6-second timeout.
fields.summary: Wrong time unit in CVS Timeout parameter of CVS Module

fields.description: Bold looks better.
fields.summary: Column and Row showing totals in "Two Dimensional Filter Statistics" in JIRA 3.x are Bold, in 4.0 - regular

fields.description: See screenshot attached. There is no 4.0 in the list whereas some issues reported by me are scheduled on 4.0.
fields.summary: Why unreleased versions are not in the list in "Two Deminsional Filter Statistics"

fields.description:
Color cannot define visibility of the caption.
Some portlets without caption look confusing, like *Watched Issues*.
Without caption, it's not clear what is the list.
Especially funny, when I minimize portlet - nothing on the screen.
fields.summary: There is no logic in behavior - portlet caption in default color is not seen, in custom color always seen

fields.description:
I added to my dashboard *Issue Statistic* portlet with my filter *JIRA Issues Resolved in a Week* grouped by *Fix For Versions (non-archived)*.
Filter returns nothing -
!Portlet.jpg!

When I checked my filter condition clicking filter name in the portlet, it is not what I configured -
!FilterConditionfromPortlet.jpg!
I didn't define *Resolutions* in my filter.

Here is what my filter shows when I select it from list of filters -
!MyFilter.jpg!
fields.summary: Wrong filter work in Issue Statistics portlet

fields.description:
Vertical dash line on the right of the down arrow, it will show that arrow relates to the command on the left of the arrow. And move arrow closer to the text.
See screenshot with suggestion.
fields.summary: Cosmetics to main JIRA menu

fields.description:
Why you removed copy portlet command in JIRA 4.0?
I use it regularly, it saves my time.
Why not to add it to drop down portlet menu?
fields.summary: No "Copy Portlet" command when configuring dashboard

fields.description:
Right now, a user with "create issue" permission can create a new issue for all types (bug, improvement, new feature, task, etc..). We would like JIRA follows our internal process where only specific users can open only specific issues types. I.e
- Users can olny open "bugs" and "new request"
- System Engineer can open "features" and "requirements"
- Project management can open "Tasks"
etc...

in that situation an external user cannot open "tasks", etc.. that are only for internal project management, for instance..
fields.summary: Allow to create or not different type issues for different users

fields.description:
Now that we have a jira.home directory, we should output atlassian-jira.log file to <jira.home> directory, and stop polluting the application directory -
{code}ajay-sridhars-mac-pro:atlassian-jira-enterprise-4.0.0-Beta5-standalone asridhar$ ls -al atlassian-jira*log
-rw-r--r--   1 asridhar  staff       0 18 Sep 10:59 atlassian-jira-http-access.log
-rw-r--r--   1 asridhar  staff       0 18 Sep 10:59 atlassian-jira-http-dump.log
-rw-r--r--   1 asridhar  staff       0 18 Sep 10:59 atlassian-jira-slow-queries.log
-rw-r--r--   1 asridhar  staff       0 18 Sep 10:59 atlassian-jira-soap-access.log
-rw-r--r--   1 asridhar  staff       0 18 Sep 10:59 atlassian-jira-soap-dump.log
-rw-r--r--   1 asridhar  staff       0 18 Sep 10:59 atlassian-jira-sql.log
-rw-r--r--   1 asridhar  staff  200466 18 Sep 11:09 atlassian-jira.log
{code}

In confluence the atlassian-confluence.log file is outputted to <Confluence-Home>/logs directory, which makes finding logs for support easy
fields.summary: Output JIRA logs to jira.home directory

fields.description:
Example:

Steps:
1. Restore the attached data.
2. Login as veenu/pass.
3. Goto advanced view and run a query "project = dashboard and fixVersion not in releasedVersion().

Result:
1. No matching issues.
2. I was expecting all issues in dashboard project having fix version which are not released.

Expected:
1. It should return all issues having fixVersion which is not released.
fields.summary: JQL query "not in ()" dont work as expected

fields.description: There's a section in the javascript (project-gadget.xml) to set the minHeight of all project list items to the maxHeight within all of them. However this is initially 0px when the configuration is saved. This produces mismatching list items. The gadget displays fine if it is refreshed.
fields.summary: The height of each project in the Projects gadget are not set to the correct minHeight
JIRA form template sets the id of the submit button to be the same as the value

fields.description:
For gadgets showing stats on day/week/month......that can be configurable in jira-application.properties. we need to document that.


The limit on the field is controlled by the following properties in the jira-application.properties file:

jira.chart.days.previous.limit.yearly=36500
jira.chart.days.previous.limit.quarterly=22500
jira.chart.days.previous.limit.monthly=7500
jira.chart.days.previous.limit.weekly=1750
jira.chart.days.previous.limit.daily=300
jira.chart.days.previous.limit.hourly=10
fields.summary: JIRA gadget documentation needs to have information for configurable options

fields.description:
Taken from EACJ logs



2009-09-17 23:38:29,644 main WARN     [jira.issue.managers.DefaultCustomFieldManager] Custom field searcher module: com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:exactnumber-gh is invalid. Null being returned.


GreenHopper                         : com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira
          Version                             : 4.0-SNAPSHOT-jira40
          Status                              : enabled
          Vendor                              : Atlassian
          Description                         : Rich Management Client for JIRA


ps looks like GreenHopper does not report its right version.  The jar on eacj is

jira-greenhopper-plugin-4.0-beta6-jira40-complete.jar

but its internally reporting itself pretty badly.
fields.summary: GreenHopper on EACJ produces a weird log messages - Needs investigation
JIRA should remember the last selected project/issue type for user on next login

fields.description:
On the Browse Fix For Version page the items in the "Other" drop down for creating issues are:
# Not vertically aligned to the centre of the icon
# Too close the icon horizontally

Things work correctly on the Browse Project and Browse Component pages.
fields.summary: The issue types in the "Other" drop down for creating issue on the Browse Fix For Version page are not middle aligned vertically

fields.description:
The activity stream does not appear to be correctly resizing on JAC. In the attached image you can see the last item is cut off and there is no "MORE" link.

I did notice that the activity stream is also having throbbing ;-) problems. The throbber seems to still be shown for a short time while content is rendered. I reported this in JRA-19126 and it was apparently obsolete. Not sure if related.
fields.summary: Acticity Stream Gadget Does not resize correctly on JAC

fields.description: When viewing all categories in the project gadget, the gadget gets stuck loading if a category with a single project exists, and the project has browse permissions disabled. Probably because the relevant category object has no projects attribute?
fields.summary: Project gadget stalls viewing all categories when one category has a single project with browse permissions disabled
Change the login gadget to have all it's props passed in as hidden user prefs to avoid extra request to server

fields.description:
In the new project view in Jira 4.0, I would like to be able to have a tab called "Project Dashboard".  Clicking this tab would display a custom dashboard that had been designated as the official dashboard for the project.

On the Administer Project page would be a new configuration option where you could select the official dashboard.  If this value was set and the current user had permissions to view that dashboard, then the user would see "Project Dashboard" as the first tab in left-hand column in the project view, and that tab would be the default view for first visits to the project view instead of "Summary".
fields.summary: Add the ability to designate an "official" dashboard per project
Add ability to sort by Version / Component names

fields.description: Not often, but sometimes, I get an issue that needs to be jumped from on step to another step that would take several clicks through the workflow (usually it needs to go backwards in the workflow). Creating a transition at every step for this possiblility is a waste of space and time, and would leave the left menu cluttered. I would like if the admin could have a transition option where she could select the step she wishes the issue to be moved to directly.
fields.summary: workflow step

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-19155].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; unfortunately we don't have any plans to support this in JIRA for the foreseeable future.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

I'd like to be able to create an activity stream based on a component in a project.

It seems to be the easiest way to accomplish this would be to allow filters for issues to serve as the feeding system for the activity stream.
fields.summary: Activity Stream should be able to pull in based on a filter

fields.description:
See screenshot attached - no right border.
*NOTE:* Reproduced on BETA5, there is no BETA5 in *Affects Version* list, so I had to select BETA4
fields.summary: Portlet border disappears on some scales when I zoom-in in FireFox

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce: 
1. Start typing case id in quick search field 
2. Use arrow keys to select one of the matching cases 
3. Hit tab to select, then enter to search (hitting enter twice seems to work, though) 

Instead of getting the page for the selected case, you end up at a seemingly random url... 

Reproduced on both IE and Firefox.
fields.summary: Quick Search: When selecting a cached case number in Quick Search with TAB Jira puts focus incorrectly
